did.unittitle: University of Connecticut, History Department Records

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Materials pertaining to the programs and activities of the department.The collection contains materials from the history department during from the 1950s through the early twenty-first century. It contains the department's administrative records, along with correspondence, news clippings, notes, publications, financial records, and awards.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of Connecticut. Department of History

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The history department provides an environment to study the diversity of human experience across time space, and helps students develop skills that enable them to understand the complex ways the past shapes the present and future. Through the department's courses and programs, it seeks not only to train future historians but to produce thoughtful and well-informed citizens. Graduates of the department have successfully pursued careers in business, public service, museum work, public history, law, and various other professions. In addition to offering a major and a minor in history, the department also offers graduate programs, with a Master's and a Ph.D. in Medieval European, Early Modern and Modern Europe, United States and Latin American history.
More information about the department and its faculty, programs and events is available on its website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials about the programs of the history department during from the 1950s through the early twenty-first century. The collection is divided into two series, and contains administrative records, along with correspondence, news clippings, notes, publications, financial records, and awards. The series are divided between records dating from primarily the 1970s, and records consisting of documents from the 1950s to the present.

The first series contains administrative records concerning the department's activities for the American Bicentennial as well as curriculum revisions. The addition to the collection, donated in 2010, contains a varitey of materials from the department from the 1950s to 2006. Subjects in the collection include the American Association of University Professors (AAUP), Departmental Advisory Committee, Afro-American History Month and Cultural Center, American Antiquarian Society, American Historical Association, Alumni Association Awards, American Association for State and Local History, American Studies Program, University Archives, Asian-American Studies, Homer Babbidge History Dept. Chair Files, UConn Bicentennial Lectures, and University of Connecticut Branch campuses at Hartford, Avery Point, Stamford, Torrington, and Waterbury.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], University Of Connecticut, History Department Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred to Archives & Special Collections by the history department faculty in 1999 and 2010.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.
